current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To direct the Under Secretary of Defense (Comptroller) to carry out a pilot program to develop innovative consumer financial products that encourage savings and wealth-creation among members of the Armed Forces on active duty.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(Comptroller) shall carry out a 5-year pilot program to develop
			 innovative consumer financial products that encourage savings and
			 wealth-creation among members of the Armed Forces on active duty.

text.#text: The

Financial
			 products developed under this section may be designed to—

increase the rate of savings among
			 members of the Armed Forces on active duty by providing automatic deposit into a savings
			 account of special pay and allowances received by such a member, including
			 special pay and allowances received on account of the deployment of the member;

reduce the need for high-cost short-term
			 lending services by providing alternatives to members of the Armed Forces on active duty, such as
			 financial institutions providing an option for such members to receive
			 advances on their salary payments—

in a manner that permits such members to receive pay in
			 more frequent installments; and
under which any interest or fees on such advances—
does not exceed the rate described in

adheres to the Affordable Small-Dollar Loan Guidelines
			 of the

address obstacles to traditional consumer
			 banking and lending for members of the Armed Forces with limited credit history; and

otherwise
			 encourage savings and wealth-creation among members of the Armed Forces on active duty.

The
			 pilot program carried out under this section shall be carried out in a manner that does not exacerbate the incidence of credit overextension among
			 members of the Armed Forces.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall select at least 10 military installations on which to
			 implement the pilot program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or seeking to renew an
			 agreement to operate on such an installation, shall—

text.#text:
A financial institution
			 seeking to begin operating on a military installation
			 selected by the

agree to offer the
			 consumer financial products developed under this section; and

notify members of the Armed Forces  that are customers of
			 the institution about the availability of the consumer financial products
			 developed under this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consult with Federal banking
			 regulators with expertise in depository institutions, Federal agencies with
			 experience regulating financial products, and consumer and military service
			 organizations with relevant financial expertise.

text.#text:
In developing consumer financial products
			 under this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall contract for an independent evaluation of the pilot program carried out
			 under this section. Such evaluation shall—

text.#text:
Not later than the date that is 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act,
			 and annually thereafter until the end of the pilot program, the

include the
			 degree to which the pilot program succeeded in the goals of increasing usage of
			 savings products, programs, and tools among members of the Armed Forces on active duty; and

be conducted
			 by a contractor with knowledge of consumer financial products and experience in
			 the evaluation of such products.

a report containing all findings and conclusions made by the contractor in
